content.description:
Steep and crimpy route on less than stellar rock.

Start right of the shallow trough at ground level.

Watch out for rattlesnakes.
content.protection: 5 lead bolts to two bolt anchor.
content.location: Right of the Pinnacle on the main face.

content.description:
Crux is low off the ground, getting past the bolts.  Clip bolt, then follow thin seam up left, clip bolt, then seam ends and there's a shallow edge heading back up and to the right.

Join and ascend the shallow left-rising ledge to a crack and follow crack (5.7-ish) to fixed anchor.

Note:  the finish up the crack to the anchor may contain some loose rock.  Take care.
content.protection: 1st bolt is a red Metolius hanger.  Second is a painted brown Bluewater hanger.  Standard rack after those two bolts leads to the fixed anchor atop the good stance at the top of the route.
content.location:
Located directly behind the Pinnacle.

Find the first protection bolt, a red Metolious hanger, left of the small block on Andesite for Sore Eyes.

There's a bolted 5.10ish sport route to the left with a fixed two bolt anchor (located to the right of a fairly big corner).

content.description:
Climb a corner crack to an undercling jog to the right, then, short corner, up to anchor.

Loose rock.

Watch out for rattlesnakes.

climbs.name: Andesite for Sore Eyes
climbs.fa: Brian Cabe and Patty Black 9 September 2001

content.description:
Start by surmounting the small block at the base of the route, then, up a cram leading to a slightly right slanty crack.  At the top of the crack, head left up lower angle face/arete to bolted anchor at junction with the steeper, tall wall to the left.  Good stance at the anchor.

Loose rock and poor protection:  take care!
content.protection: Standard rack to include small cams and stoppers.  No fixed lead gear.  Fixed anchor.
content.location: Directly behind the Pinnacle.  Starts off a small block to the right of a thin crack/seam (and the route Mock Hospitality).  Rappel from fixed anchor atop route.
